alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:06AM CST until January 29 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Brazos River near Rosharon affecting Brazoria and Fort Bend Counties. For the Brazos River...including Bryan, West Columbia, US 59, Sugar Land, TX, Hempstead, Bellville, San Felipe, Richmond, Rosharon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brazos River near Rosharon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 46.5 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues. Livestock should be removed from low areas in the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 44.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 40.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Sunday was 45.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 15.8 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 45.2 feet on 03/15/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Brazos River Rosharon 43.0 44.8 Sun 10 am CS 42.7 38.9 26.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.late tonight at 415 AM CST.
